action.action-desc: Mr. Good of Virginia introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Labor

form.official-title: To amend the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act to remove the requirements relating to registered apprenticeships.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Apprenticeship Freedom Act.

subsection.text: Section 3(7)(B) of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (29 U.S.C. 3102(7)(B)) is amended by striking registered and all that follows, and inserting a semicolon.
Section 122(a) of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (29 U.S.C. 3152(a)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by amending paragraph (2)(B) to read as follows:

subparagraph.text: an entity that carries out apprenticeships; or

paragraph.text: in paragraph (3), by striking for so long as the corresponding program of the provider remains registered.

subsection.text: Section 171 of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (29 U.S.C. 3226) is amended—

subparagraph.text: by redesignating paragraphs (11) and (12) as paragraphs (10) and (11), respectively; and

paragraph.text: by striking registered each place it appears.
